assessments.status_rationale: Today’s bullets include personal-finance mortgage-related commentary but no Freddie Mac PMMS data point indicating the 30-year fixed rate hit ≤5.50%. No confirming or disconfirming evidence.
No H.4.1 / Federal Reserve balance sheet update is referenced in today’s news bullets, so there’s no evidence about changes in reported Agency MBS holdings relative to 2026-01-08.
A CNBC item mentions a 'hiring recession' but provides no BLS seasonally adjusted total nonfarm payrolls monthly change (<0) for a 2026 H1 reference month. No outcome evidence.
No reporting here indicates EU–Mercosur negotiations are concluded or that finalized legal/consolidated text has been published on an official site.

The news focuses on protests in Iran and U.S. policy deliberations, but does not describe a new UK/EU Iran human-rights sanctions package designating ≥10 individuals/entities in a single action linked to protest suppression.
No mention in today’s bullets of Meta disclosing any binding long-term nuclear power offtake agreement totaling ≥1.0 GW.
There is no item about SB Energy reaching financial close and beginning construction on ≥2.0 GW (AC) of U.S. solar/solar+storage projects in 2026 tied to an OpenAI/SoftBank-backed raise/partnership.

CNBC notes what Big Oil executives told Trump about investing in Venezuela, but does not report a public announcement of a signed MoU/term sheet/framework agreement by a named major IOC for ≥$5B contingent on U.S. authorization/sanctions relief.

A NYT piece discusses Trump and Greenland geopolitics, but nothing indicates Denmark announced a specific new Greenland surveillance/deployment measure (UAV procurement/lease or additional regular rotations beyond 2025 baselines).
No funding-round announcement is included indicating a16z led a disclosed $300M+ round into a U.S.-headquartered defense or dual-use technology company.
No FDA docket/RFI/ANPRM/proposed rule is referenced regarding reviewing/restricting a widely used preservative with explicit mention of metabolic outcomes such as diabetes risk.
